SENT.plain: Sixteen cases of odontogenic keratocyst are reported
Two of the patients had basal cell nevus syndrome
The provisional diagnosis in most of the 16 cases was other than odontogenic keratocyst, and the presenting symptoms were usually swelling, pain, and sinus tract formation
The treatment varied from simple enucleation to marsupialization, homogenous bone grafting, and iliac bone grafting
There was a 25% recurrence rate, mostly associated with treatment by enucleation, cysts that were parakeratinized or difficulty in removing the lesion
